verses.verse: Why <WH4100> do the heathen<WH1471> rage,<WH7283> and the people<WH3816> imagine<WH1897> a vain thing?<WH7385>

The kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> set themselves,<WH3320> and the rulers<WH7336> take counsel<WH3245> together,<WH3162> against<WH5921> the LORD,<WH3068> and against<WH5921> his anointed,<WH4899> saying,
Let us break their bands asunder,<WH5423> <WH853> <WH4147> and cast away<WH7993> their cords<WH5688> from<WH4480> us.
He that sitteth<WH3427> in the heavens<WH8064> shall laugh:<WH7832> the Lord<WH136> shall have them in derision.<WH3932>
Then <WH227> shall he speak<WH1696> unto<WH413> them in his wrath,<WH639> and vex<WH926> them in his sore displeasure.<WH2740>
Yet have I<WH589> set<WH5258> my king<WH4428> upon<WH5921> my holy<WH6944> hill<WH2022> of Zion.<WH6726>
I will declare<WH5608> <WH413> the decree:<WH2706> the LORD<WH3068> hath said<WH559> unto<WH413> me, Thou<WH859> art my Son;<WH1121> this day<WH3117> have I<WH589> begotten<WH3205> thee.
Ask <WH7592> of<WH4480> me, and I shall give<WH5414> thee the heathen<WH1471> for thine inheritance,<WH5159> and the uttermost parts<WH657> of the earth<WH776> for thy possession.<WH272>
Thou shalt break<WH7489> them with a rod<WH7626> of iron;<WH1270> thou shalt dash them in pieces<WH5310> like a potter's<WH3335> vessel.<WH3627>
Be wise<WH7919> now<WH6258> therefore, O ye kings:<WH4428> be instructed,<WH3256> ye judges<WH8199> of the earth.<WH776>
Serve <WH5647> <WH853> the LORD<WH3068> with fear,<WH3374> and rejoice<WH1523> with trembling.<WH7461>

Kiss <WH5401> the Son,<WH1248> lest<WH6435> he be angry,<WH599> and ye perish<WH6> from the way,<WH1870> when<WH3588> his wrath<WH639> is kindled<WH1197> but a little.<WH4592> Blessed<WH835> are all<WH3605> they that put their trust<WH2620> in him.
